android.health.manager
Class HealthCoach

java.lang.Object
  android.health.manager.HealthCoach

public class HealthCoach
extends java.lang.Object

This class is responsible for handling all application interaction with the actual calorie summaries of both intake and expenditure through exercise. This class also makes this information available to the rest of the application, as well as providing all the caloric balancing advice.

Author:
John Mauldin - Initial code stub and Diet Manager query support, Joel Botner - Pedometer Database query support and caloric balancer functionality

Constructor Summary
HealthCoach(SharedPreferences thePrefs, PedometerDatabaseAdapter exerciseDB, Activity callingActivity)
           
 
Method Summary
 int getTotalCaloriesBurned(int window)
          This queries the exercise logs database to obtain how many calories were burned through exercise over the window specified (1 is the last 24 hours, 2 is the last 7 days, and 3 is the last 30 days)
 int getTotalCaloriesEaten(int window)
          This queries the logged meals database to obtain how many calories were consumed over the window specified (1 is the last 24 hours, 2 is the last 7 days, and 3 is the last 30 days)
 int recommendCalories()
          Identifies how many calories still need to be burned to achieve the minimal calories burned goal.
 int recommendCalories(int window)
          Identifies how many calories still need to be burned to achieve the minimal calories burned goal.

Method Detail

getTotalCaloriesBurned

public int getTotalCaloriesBurned(int window)
This queries the exercise logs database to obtain how many calories were burned through exercise over the window specified (1 is the last 24 hours, 2 is the last 7 days, and 3 is the last 30 days)

Parameters:
window - - Which window to obtain calorie burned during.
Returns:
The number of calories the user burned over the course of this window.

getTotalCaloriesEaten

public int getTotalCaloriesEaten(int window)
This queries the logged meals database to obtain how many calories were consumed over the window specified (1 is the last 24 hours, 2 is the last 7 days, and 3 is the last 30 days)

Parameters:
window - - Which window to obtain caloric consumption for.
Returns:
The number of calories the user ate over this window.

recommendCalories

public int recommendCalories()
Identifies how many calories still need to be burned to achieve the minimal calories burned goal.

Returns:
How many calories must still be burned to achieve the minimal calories burned goal over this window. A negative value means you have surpassed your goal by the specified amount.

recommendCalories

public int recommendCalories(int window)
Identifies how many calories still need to be burned to achieve the minimal calories burned goal. Same as above recommendCalories(), but you can

Returns:
How many calories must still be burned to achieve the minimal calories burned goal over the specified window. A negative value means you have surpassed your goal by the specified amount.
